NAK What is holding up a partnership with PLP I dont think it is so much the uncertainty of whether we will get a permit but rather the current price of copper which makes it difficult for a major to pull the trigger on a Pebble investment requiring a capex of 55 billion including the cost of permitting according to an RFI from PLP The current price of copper makes the project barely economic Another factor may be NDMs current low market cap which makes it difficult to sell a Pebble investment to the Board and to shareholders The question would likely be raised why would you consider paying 15 billion for a 50 interest in a company that the market values at only 162 million

NAK Will the world need more or less copper in the future The consensus is clearly that it will require more barring a worldwide depression that doesnt seem to be in the cards As the third world becomes more prosperous people will want the benefits that electricity will bring and as everybody knows electrons run on copper wire The demand will exceed the supply and the price of copper will rise to where the demand curve and the supply curve intersect recall your Economics 101 Because it takes time to bring new copper mines into production to meet the demand the supply gap will widen and copper prices will continue to rise during the coming cycle
